Michel Verdure, Seabourn 3 CONNECT 17 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE As the political season heats up politicians and pundits carry political discourse from land to the high seas. Cruise passengers are invited to join the fun, attending lectures and expressing opinions. Senators and former governors are among speakers on upcoming theme cruises and so are some former presidential candidates. Unfortunately if you're looking for one featuring Donald Trump, you're out of luck: he is among those not yet scheduled to do a cruise.
Here are 10 cruises where discussing politics is the order of the day.
Conspira-Sea Cruise: Setting sail for the Mexican Riviera from Los Angeles on January 24, the one-week Conspira-Sea Cruise features dozens of experts talking "truth about things conspiratorial," according to the producer's websites. Topics will include bee colony collapse, global warming, fracking, government corruption, political corruption, the Federal Reserve, medical suppression, identity chips, the Second Amendment and basically any conspiracy theory you can think of. The sailing is on the Ruby Princess, fares from $1,389 per person.
Young America Foundation Cruise: Sponsored by YAF, a conservative outreach organization, this 10-day South America cruise on the Crystal Symphony sets sail from Rio de Janeiro to Buenos Aires on January 3. Speakers on the Young America Foundation Cruise will include conservative leader Edwin Meese III, YAF president Rob Robinson, former U.S. Ambassador to Singapore Patricia L. Herbold and Robert (Bob) Herbold, retired EVP and COO of Microsoft Corporation. Fares are from $5,990.
Scott Brown sailing: The former U.S. senator for Massachusetts and now a political contributor to Fox News, Scott Brown will headline a seven-day cruise from Miami to San Juan on the Crystal Symphony, embarking November 14, fares from $1,985. A Republican, Brown will lecture as part of Crystal Cruise Line's Visions Enrichment Program, which encourages onboard discussions and debates.
Alan Simpson sailing: The former U.S. Senator from Wyoming will be featured speaker onboard the Crystal Symphony, on a two-week Caribbean cruise from Miami embarking November 28. During his time in the Senate (1979 to 1997) Alan Simpson was a conservative and opponent of government regulation, as well as an outspoken advocate for access to abortion, gay and lesbian rights (according to his resume). Simpson served as Republic Whip for a decade. Fares are from $3,970.
Bob Graham sailing: The former Florida governor will lecture and mingle with guests onboard the Crystal Serenity on a 12-day cruise from Marseilles, France to Lisbon, embarking November 29. Bob Graham , who also served in the U.S. Senate (from 1987 to 2005), can talk first-hand about running for president â€“ he sought the 2004 Democratic presidential nomination. Fares are from $3,375.
Media Research Center Cruise: Gathering on Holland America Line's Westerdam for a one-week Caribbean cruise from Fort Lauderdale will be Tea Party Patriots and others drawn by guest speakers including syndicated columnist Cal Thomas, Tony Perkins of the Washington-based Family Research Council, former Puerto Rico governor Luis Fortuno and Sen. Mike Lee, R-Utah. The Media Research Center Cruise embarks February 13, fares from $1,452.
The Nation's 150th Anniversary Cruise: Past and present editors of The Nation, including Katrina vanden Heuvel and Victor Navasky, will be onboard Holland America's Nieuw Amsterdam for a one-week Caribbean cruise, embarking Fort Lauderdale on December 13. Other progressive speakers include five-time presidential candidate Ralph Nader, broadcaster Laura Flanders and political blogger John Nichols. The Nation's 150th Anniversary Cruise embarks Fort Lauderdale on December 13. Fares are from $1,889.
Steve Forbes sailing: Chairman and Editor-in-Chief of Forbes Media Steve Forbes will talk politics and more when he joins a 77-day Pacific exploration cruise on the Seabourn Odyssey (the cruise embarks January 4 from Los Angeles; Forbes will be onboard February 15 to 19. Steve Forbes was a Republican candidate in the 1996 and 2000 presidential primaries.
Dan Rather sailing: On a 20-day Panama Canal cruise on the Seabourn Odyssey, embarking on March 21, you can hear from news anchor Dan Rather, who knows a thing or two about politics having helmed the CBS Evening News for a record-breaking 24 years. Dan Rather , author of the autobiography "Rather Outspoken," will be onboard the luxury ship for three nights; fares from $9,999.
The Weekly Standard Cruise: There are plans for a TWS cruise in 2016 focused on the conservative agenda, according to organizers. You can sign up for a mailing list for details. On the magazine's last cruise, in August, speakers included pro-life political activist and one-time Republican presidential candidate Gary Bauer.
